If you marry a chicken, follow the chicken (idiom); A woman should follow whatever her husband orders./We must learn to accept the people around us.

Confucian moral injunctions for women, namely: obey in turn three men father, husband and son, plus the four virtues of morality 德, physical charm 容, propriety in speech 言 and efficiency in needlework 功
a woman's virtue is to have no talent (idiom)
pinyin: nu:3 zi3 wu2 cai2 bian4 shi4 de2

definition: to be officially wed
to stay at home while one's husband is away/grass widow
forced marriage/arranged marriage (without the consent of the individuals)
faithful unto death (i.e. Confucian ban on widow remarrying)
to marry and live with the bride's family (inverting traditional Chinese expectations)
to remarry (of a woman)
to get married (of woman)

lit. if you have to use force to break a melon off the vine, it won't taste sweet (because it's only when the melon is ripe that it can be removed with just a slight twist) (idiom)/fig. if sth is not meant to be, it's no use trying to force it to happen
pinyin: qiang3 niu3 de5 gua1 bu4 tian2

definition: (of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)
an ugly wife is a treasure at home (idiom)

definition: child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
